Assistance: Funds are essential for expeditions. Followers will allow me to pass obstacles.

recipes: Eyes like gas-lamps; scales like black jade. A Serpent is a powerful foe, but it's nothing before us.
Separate failure event means this should never be visible.
Eyes like gas-lamps; fangs like stalactites. A great Serpent is a powerful foe, but so are we.
Separate failure event means this should never be visible.
Our strength may not be enough.
Eyes like gas-lamps; a mouth one could crouch in. We might defeat this Serpent. We might regret trying.
Separate failure event means this should never be visible.
We call upon the Mother of Ants, which ariseth from wounds.
The Serpent's mouth is large enough to crouch in. Its tongue is the thickness of a man's shoulders. But surely it will respect the power we bear.
Separate failure event means this should never be visible.
We call upon the Mother of Ants, which encircleth.
The Serpent is long enough to coil round a cottage. Its fangs glisten like ice. Probably it will respect the power we bear.
Separate failure event means this should never be visible.
We call upon the Mother of Ants, which openeth.
The Serpent rears up like swelling river. Its eyes are slitted pits of hunger. Perhaps the Serpent will respect the power we bear.
Separate failure event means this should never be visible.
The Serpent rolls and roars! Its death throes shake the earth! But it's dying. We will pass.
It lowers its great head. Moisture seeps from its lidless eyes. Is it weeping? What does it remember of its eldest sister, whose power we call upon?
Back. Back! It's too much for us!

Assistance: Funds are essential for expeditions. Followers will allow me to pass obstacles.

recipes: The Dead are pale as inverse shadows. They move like cobwebs in a breeze. They can't stand before us. We'll send them mumbling back into the shadows of the Wood.
Separate failure event means this should never be visible.
These things, with their avid, pitiful eyes, have died once already. Their hold on the waking world is weak. We should be able to send them down into darkness, but we must take care.
Separate failure event means this should never be visible.
Our strength may not be enough.
The Dead are slow as the movement of a sundial's shadow - slow, but ceaseless. They remember pain and fear, but not clearly. We know both sensations too well. They may be too much for us.
Separate failure event means this should never be visible.
We call upon the Ivory Dove, who knows the names of all the dead.
The Dead circle the edge of our vision like frayed dreams. The very air around us is chill with Winter's shadow. They must recognise that.
Separate failure event means this should never be visible.
We call upon the Ivory Dove, who cannot be deceived.
The Dead watch us closely, expressionless as saint-statues. But we are invested with the power of Winter. Probably the Dead will recognise that.
Separate failure event means this should never be visible.
We call upon the Ivory Dove, from whom nothing more may be taken.
The Dead boil and rattle in the darkness, but we have been touched by the Hours of Winter. Perhaps they will recognise that.
Separate failure event means this should never be visible.
When the Dead return to us, they use what matter they can if their bodies are gone: dust, rust, cobwebs, scraps and tatters. Now that we have broken them, these tatters are all that remain.
The Dead draw back, their almost-faces flat and watchful. They will not trouble us.
The Dead are more like wind than flesh, but it doesn't do to underrate the wind. Just now, they are a terror-fanged hurricane of pale shadow. Fall back. Fall back!
